channel.title: Xbox 360 Live
channel.description:
Hey guys, well what I basically need is some info for live.
So I'll just buy the membership card. I have a 360 arcade.
Anyways I need a cheaper way then buying a 360 network adapter. So can I use like an ethernet cable or something cheaper?
And what else do I need? Thanks xD

item.title: Xbox 360 Live
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Paranoid folks who think terrorists will use their connection to publish a video will shut it off. And my laptop is quite static, I have an external hdd which carries everything I don’t have to use for school. So I don’t need wireless for my laptop. But I also have a PSP, so I can’t turn WiFi off.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Live
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

Why would you own a Laptop and not have a wireless network. I’m sure there are many people that do, but having a wireless network makes things so much easier. I mean, I use an ethernet cable for my xbox, but that’s only because I had a cable long enough to reach, and it was easier than converting a wireless router I had into an access point.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Live
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:16, topic:262792”][quote author=Tico135 link=topic=347036.msg2673919#msg2673919 date=1234960167]
…
If you own a laptop (works best) with an internet connection, you can buy something called a crossover cable, in which you can plug one end into your xbox and the other into your computer, set the connection as shared (on the computer) and you can retrieve a connection.
[/quote]

He’ll NEED a wireless router for that.[/quote]

I used to have a USB<->Ethernet thingy, which gives you an extra Ethernet port. So he doesn’t need a wireless router for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Live
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:15, topic:262792”]…
If you own a laptop (works best) with an internet connection, you can buy something called a crossover cable, in which you can plug one end into your xbox and the other into your computer, set the connection as shared (on the computer) and you can retrieve a connection.[/quote]

He’ll NEED a wireless router for that.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Live
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

You can do one of four things:

Buy an ethernet cable, and plug it into your modem (obviously the other device that was plugged in before will not have internet access).

Buy an ethernet cable, and a wired router, plug an ethernet cable from your modem to the wired router, and branch out ethernet cables from the wired router.

Buy a wireless router, and an xbox 360 wireless adapter, plug your modem into the router, and have a wireless signal.

If you own a laptop (works best) with an internet connection, you can buy something called a crossover cable, in which you can plug one end into your xbox and the other into your computer, set the connection as shared (on the computer) and you can retrieve a connection.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Live
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“ThAt0n36Uy, post:10, topic:262792”][quote author=casey. link=topic=347036.msg2673106#msg2673106 date=1234909121]
connect kit is like 100$

Just use cable…
[/quote]

I was talking about the old one.

amazon.com

Amazon.com: Microsoft Wireless-G Xbox Adapter: Artist Not Provided: Electronics

Either way he’s going to need to get a Wireless router. Almost everyone has them now. He’ll need it later on I bet. Might as well get it now.[/quote]

He doesn’t NEED a wireless router, a regular wired router will do fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 Live
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

You need to buy a Wireless router, and plug the modem into the supply for the router, then plug the computer into an open port on the back of the router. Then buy the old Xbox Wireless Connect Kit, and connect using that.

Read full topic
